result.execSummary:
The defendant Grant D Tolksdorf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be payable to Rib Mt Golf Course at the rate of at least $100 per month.
GFE Maintain/obtain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, if not engaged then complete 10 hours community service.
No contact with Rib Mt. Golf Course or P.N.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
May apply for expungement upon completion of probation.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Grant D Tolksdorf

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certificate of Discharge and Satisfaction of Probation - Conditions for Expungement - DENIED

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Charli
Case Called: 10:30 a.m.
INCLUDES: 16CM80, 16CM81
State appears by ADA Chad Minder.  Def appears in person with Atty Cana Laska.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to:
16CM80
Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property-PTAC)>> DRI
COURT grants above.

PLEA: 
16CM81
Ct. 1 (Theft-Movable Property <=$2500)>> Guilty 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: S/H 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessment/Counseling/Treatment as deemed appropriate by agent; No Contact with P.N. AND No Contact with Rib Mountain Golf Course; Maintain fulltime employment/schooling or combination of the two, if not engaged, GFE to obtain status AND 10 hours CS per week; Joint/Several Restitution in amount of $5,500.00 to Rib Mountain Golf Course, Deft portion to be paid not less than $100 per month; DNA Sample and Surcharge.

Deft may apply  for Expungement upon completion of probation.

Adj: 10:40 a.m.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 16CM80 and 81 called: 9:24am
State appears by ADA C.Minder ; Defendant does not appear -- Atty Cana Laska appears on his behalf
(set for Plea)

Defendant is in his high school classes at this time; Parties do not have agreement at this time and request dates stay on court's calendar.
COURT keeps dates on as originally set - bond continues.

Includes 16CM80 and 16CM81.    No contact with victim(s): P.N. and Rib Mountain Golf Course.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Attend all classes at school unless excused by doctor.
